EXTRACTED VALUE: The gameplay mechanics in Gun are a lot of fun, and can be picked up and learned pretty easily with a little tiny bit of practice.
Enormous, intelligent, wily - a true dragon. [Sept 2007, p.98]
It's "Flatout 2," given a seriously pretty makeover and superior solidity. Win! [Aug 2007, p.77]
Hell's Highway is a polished, coherent experience that, despite a few setbacks, remains compelling with interesting mechanics and compelling gameplay.
Don’t get me wrong, the graphics aren’t next-gen quality but they sure are eons better than the crap you see in the PS2 version.
One of those rare licensed games that actually transcends its license to provide a great gaming experience for anyone willing to give it a shot.
Force Unleashed is one of the finest Star Wars games to hit consoles yet. A must buy for Star Wars fans the world over.
Need For Speed Carbon takes the lead among next-gen street racers.
Mercs 2 is a largely successful effort that will literally give you more "bang" for your buck than most games out there.
If you're interested in taking on a captivating yet downright terrifying single player experience, F.E.A.R. comes highly recommended.
A great hockey game, pure and simple...NHL 07 represents the first truly next-generation gameplay innovation.
More precise skate speed control and a revised skill stick make NHL 08 an icy-hot dream.
Finding your groove in this game, if you are new to this sort of thing that is, takes a good amount of time.
If you are of the old school class that enjoys the simple things in life you will undoubtedly find a lot to like about this game.
